byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Suzanne Daley and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, Andrew Higgins from Brussels, Jack Ewing from Frankfurt, and David Jolly and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris.

abstract: German lawmakers vote to approve entering into negotiations for Greek bailout;  vote come as international debate over whether to provide bailout to Greece grows; breakdown of vote shows that opposition to bailout within Chancellor Angela Merkel's bloc has grown since February.
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel and her finance minister had urged legislators to back the bailout, which both called “a last attempt” to order Greece’s finances and build a functioning state.

headline.main: Germany Votes to Move Ahead With Greek Bailout, but Opposition Grows
headline.print_headline: Germany Votes to Move Ahead With Greek Bailout, but Opposition Grows

snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel and her finance minister had urged legislators to back the bailout, which both called “a last attempt” to order Greece’s finances and build a functioning state.
